A driver’s licence number is 15 characters in length; the first character is a letter and the next 14 are numbers. The last two characters must be a number from 01 to 31.

Do you have a legal issue?(required/optional)

Legal issues may include:

  • Criminal matters
  • Family law issues like divorce, child custody or support
  • Immigration and refugee matters
  • Civil claims, including ones made in small claims court
  • Issues before a tribunal or board, including landlord/tenant issues
  • Social assistance review
